name: Hotel Serotel Lutece

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from Paris, having stayed at this 3 star hotel. It was a present to us and booked by someone else. Having read the mixed reviews, i was a bit daunted, but i'm pleased to say we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Great Wee Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late (about 11:30pm) and had no trouble getting booked in. The room was small and nothing fancy, but it was very clean and quite quiet which is always a plus. The window overlooked a rear courtyard.
reviews.title: Not a bad little hotel at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found breakfast great, continental. This may not suit everybody, but there was everything from cereal, yougurts, fresh coffee, meats? toast, fruit juice. You could just help yourself and it was in a nice converted cellar. No probs with heat in the room as mentioned before.
reviews.title: Rabbit warren of a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, even making sure we had transport booked to the airport for our trip home which was half the cost of what the taxi was from the airport (55 euros!!).
reviews.title: An okay hotel - great breakfast buffet
Depressing and shabby
reviews.text: Anyway, some reviews here don't reflect the fact that this is a 3 star hotel. It serves it's purpose and i wouldn't hesitate to return.

My wife and I stayed in the Serotel Lutece in early May (6 nights). As others have noted, the rooms are small by US standards - we had a double - just enough room for a suitcase or two (don't take overly large suitcases). The bathroom is reasonably sized by comparison, but the shower stall is compact (plenty of hot water though). The rooms and hotel are clean - they were remodeling the bar/lounge while we were there - and the breakfast area in the cellar is quaint. The staff is excellent and provide great guidance and directions (train, metro, bus) - notably, Michel was very personable and friendly. It's in a very quiet area of the Latin Quarter, a short walk to the Censier-Daubenton metro stop, with a nice bakery next door (got to love the croissants). This hotel is a great deal, particularly for Paris.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in paris and stayed in "best western serotel lutece" hotel for 7 nights. I really want to recommend it.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is not small for European hotels good size – even big. Everything you need is in this room like a safe and equipment to make hot drinks.
reviews.title: You Can Do Much Better Elsewhere - Rundown & Filthy Rooms

likes.disliked: — filthy damp out dated worn out rooms

reviews.title: A good litle hotel
reviews.text: The tv has only French channels which is bad because almost all of the guests are not French. In the room you can find even an alarm clock which I ddint see in any hotel.
When we arrived to the room each night it was clean and tidy.
reviews.title: A great base to explore Paris in a nice quieter area

reviews.text: I really can't say anything bad about this hotel. My wife and I and our three children stayed here for two nights close to New Year's. This was our third trip to Paris so I looked for somewhere different to stay this time. I had booked it over the internet. The hotel is about a block and a half away from a metro stop, and the location is safe and is lively during the day with a daily street market nearby. Parking (in a garage) was available by the metro stop and was about 17 Euros a day. Our rate came with the breakfast which was more than adequate and included cereal, croissants, fruit, meat and juice. The hotel staff were very friendly and helped us out with general directions. The hotel has a bar in the lobby also. We got two rooms and both rooms were spacious enough (this is Paris!) and had a shower and tub. The rooms were quiet at night and our overall impression was very good. Don't hesitate to look up the hotel website and email with questions about the various rates and specials. I got responses back right away. Internet access is also available in the lobby and runs about 4 Euro for 15 mintues. Good luck on your trip and ENJOY PARIS!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Nice Location

reviews.text: The location of this hotel is definitely its biggest advantage. It's about an 8 minute walk from the metro station Censier-Daubenton, and surrounded by plenty of cafes and restaurants. There is also the street market which seems to be on most evenings, and is particularly lively on the weekends. The choice of cheese, fruit & veg, wine and chocolate is fantastic and the atmosphere would be hard to beat. We had to drag ourselves away to go and see the other sights!
reviews.title: Great location, but...
Great Beautiful Hotel, In a quiet location
reviews.text: The hotel itself however is quite tired, with dark corridors and a small old fashioned bedroom (we had a twin and the single bed seemed more suitable for a 3 yr old child). We also did not find the reception staff to be friendly or helpful, as other reviewers did. On the positive side, the room was clean and there was a balcony looking out onto the street which was great for people watching! As it was we left the hotel at 10am each day and did not return until midnight, but next time I would choose a hotel comfortable enough to relax in.
Me and my family were staying in this Hotel for one night, in an apartment, as we are 5 (3 children).
reviews.title: Great position & friendly staff

reviews.text: No need to say that usually Hotel rooms in Paris are very small.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

description: Charming hotel with authentic Parisian character in historic district near Pantheon, Latin Quarter and Luxembourg Gardens.
